XSL Numbering test

For '':

  • 'single' number = 1
  • 'multiple' number = 1.
  • 'any' number = 1

For '1':

  • 'single' number = 1
  • 'multiple' number = 1.
  • 'any' number = 1

BlahBlahBlah

For '1.a':

  • 'single' number = 1
  • 'multiple' number = 1.1.
  • 'any' number = 2

Nojasdsa

For '1.a.a':

  • 'single' number = 1
  • 'multiple' number = 1.1.1.
  • 'any' number = 3

BKjasda

For '1.a.b':

  • 'single' number = 2
  • 'multiple' number = 1.1.2.
  • 'any' number = 4

BKjasda

For '1.b':

  • 'single' number = 2
  • 'multiple' number = 1.2.
  • 'any' number = 5

For '2':

  • 'single' number = 2
  • 'multiple' number = 2.
  • 'any' number = 6
